One of the greatest games of all time. Completed originally on Playstation but going through it again on PC because, well why not?!

If you are looking for a puzzle game mixed with an immersive story-line, look no further! 
Dive back into the world of Aperture Science with Chell and traverse the deep underground of the facility! 
The humor is sarcastic and silly, probably my favorite out of any game. 

The controls are easy to use, with keyboard or a plug-in controller. Each stage of the game gets progressively harder (as it should), and new mechanics are introduced into the game from the previous one. There is a level creator where you can publish and play other player's creations. There is also a co-op mode. I adore this game. Always have, always will. It is a must for puzzle lovers or people who enjoy post-apocalyptic/sci-fi stories.

10 years late, but still an amazing game.

Portal 2 brings the player (and Chell) back to Aperture Laboratories, and it‚Äôs one of the most enjoyable first-person puzzle adventures yet. The gameplay mechanics start from where they left off in the first Portal, but keep adding new elements and improving it gradually, Test Chamber after Test Chamber. Eventually, Chell has an arsenal of tricks worthy of the best heroes, and her journey is one that the player will want to continue playing until the end. The story behind the game is amazing and explains not only the past of Aperture Science, but also the relationship between its creator, Cave Johnson, and Half-Life‚Äôs Black Mesa. Exploring the Depths of Aperture is one of the most incredible experiences in videogaming as a whole, both narration-wise as gameplay-wise. Add to that the incredible voice talents, the always sharp background music and a flawless technical compartment, and you got a jaw-dropping game. What tops all of this, is the personality of Wheatley, GLaDOS and Cave Johnson‚Ä¶ Portal 2 is a masterpiece. No further words needed.
Still holds up as a great game to this day

A clever and beautiful game, filled with great characters, biting dialogue, and a great splash of cold war sci-fi, which I love. If you like puzzle games and haven't played this (or the first Portal) yet, it is a necessity.
Loved it back then and loved playing it again. What a unique game concept!
Great Co-op experience. 10/10, not a lot of replay value though, that's the only downside.
good game. that's pretty much it.

Great game so far. Intriguing story and fantastic puzzle-oriented gameplay. Ya just gotta love the fact that Stephen Merchants talents have made their way past television into the video game spotlight in such a phenomenal way. It's just brilliant, bloody brilliant, isn't it. I mean, isn't it REALLY, right? Would definitely recommend this game and the game preceding this one
